summary: The document discusses a regulatory action against Richard Kahn, who was permanently barred from NYSE Arca membership due to failure to provide requested testimony to FINRA. The decision outlines the terms under which he could regain membership if he complies within a specified timeframe.

persons.name: Richard Kahn
persons.context: Richard Kahn is mentioned as a respondent in a regulatory action for failing to provide testimony as requested by FINRA.

events.title: Regulatory Action Decision
events.description: Richard Kahn and other respondents were found to have violated NYSE Arca Equities Rule 10.2(d) and were permanently barred from NYSE Arca membership unless they provided testimony within 120 days.

keyFacts: Richard Kahn was permanently barred from NYSE Arca membership due to failure to provide testimony.
The decision was issued on April 20, 2012.
Respondents have 120 days to comply with the terms of the decision to regain membership.
The action was taken on behalf of FINRA.
The document references multiple URLs for further information on the disciplinary action.
